question_text: A 29-year-old woman is evaluated for a chronic skin lesion on the anterior surface of her right leg, as shown. It is firm to palpation and forms a “dimple” when the sides are compressed.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Dermatofibromas (Option B), or fibrous histiocytomas, are benign skin lesions that appear as firm dermal nodules approximately the size of a pencil eraser; they are associated with a dimple when the lateral sides are pinched together, as shown. They are typically found on the lower extremities and are more common in women. They are usually asymptomatic or cause only minor itching.
